intro: Gonospermum ferulaceum var. latipinnum, commonly known as the broad-needle gonospermum, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its narrow, needle-like leaves that are often densely packed along the stems. It produces small, white or pale pink flowers that are clustered in spikes, typical of the Myrtaceae family. This variant is notable for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in dry, well-drained soils.
